statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: America East Men's Championship - Semifinals AT VESTAL NY

article.headline: Hartford 59, Boston U. 52
article.story: VESTAL, N.Y. (AP) -- All-Conference guard Joe Zeglinski scored seven of his 16 points during an 11-2 burst over a 3:04 span in the second half, leading second-seeded Hartford to a 59-52 win Sunday over Boston University and its first trip to the America East title game. The Hawks (18-15) had lost their nine previous semifinal games and will now visit No. 1 seed Maryland-Baltimore County next Saturday. UMBC, reaching its first final in its fifth season in the conference, defeated Vermont in the opening game Sunday. Hartford and UMBC split a pair of game during the regular season, each winning by a point on their home floor. Sixth-seeded BU (14-17) cut a 31-25 to 31-29 when Corey Lowe missed two free throws with 14:59 remaining and Zeglinski then hit two straight field goals that triggered the 11-2 run that actually grew to 15-4 and the Hawks were never really in trouble after that. Hartford beat BU for the second time in three games this season. Zeglinski was 7-for-12 from the field and had three assists and two rebounds. Warren McLendon, who didnt play when these two teams met in Boston, Feb. 28 (coachs decision), had 13 points and 10 rebounds, while Michael Turner added eight points and seven rebounds for the Hawks. Lowe led BU with 16 points, Matt Wolff had 12 points and eight rebounds and Carlos Strong came off the bench with 11 points.
